snippet: The untitled drama centered on a morning TV show is the tech giantâ€™s second play against traditional networks and Netflix.

snippet: That man who killed 26 people had an iPhone and the authorities want to gain access to it. But as in an earlier case, it is locked with a password.

headline.main: Why Texas Shooting Could Draw Apple Back Into Security Debate
headline.print_headline: New Debate Seems Likely Over iPhone Of Gunman

snippet: Apple Inc has ordered two seasons of a dramatic series that stars Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston and looks at the lives of people working on a morning television show, a company spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Apple Orders Witherspoon, Aniston Drama in TV Push
headline.print_headline: Apple Orders Witherspoon, Aniston Drama in TV Push

snippet: For about 48 hours after a deadly rampage at a Texas church, the FBI and other law enforcement agencies did not ask Apple Inc to help them unlock the gunman's iPhone or associated online accounts, a person familiar with the situation told Reuters ...

headline.main: FBI May Have Lost Critical Time Unlocking Texas Shooter's iPhone

snippet: The Chinese internet company Tencent has acquired a 12 percent stake in Snap, with the social media company struggling to boost user growth.

headline.main: Tencent Buys 12 Percent Stake in Snap
headline.print_headline: Tencent Buys 12 Percent Stake in Snap

snippet: The Texas church massacre is providing a familiar frustration for law enforcement: FBI agents are unable to unlock the gunman's encrypted cellphone to learn what evidence it might hold.

headline.main: FBI Again Finds Itself Unable to Unlock a Gunman's Cellphone
headline.print_headline: FBI Again Finds Itself Unable to Unlock a Gunman's Cellphone

snippet: If Broadcom Ltd's  unsolicited $103 billion bid for Qualcomm Inc succeeds, it could set up a battle with Intel Corp for dominance in the production of the next generation of communications chips, which will play a vital role in so-called connected...

headline.main: Qualcomm Buy May Pit Broadcom Against Intel in 'Connected Car' Fight
headline.print_headline: Qualcomm Buy May Pit Broadcom Against Intel in 'Connected Car' Fight
